name: Samurai Gunn
description: Samurai Gunn is a lightning-fast Bushido brawler for two to four players. Each samurai is armed with a sword and gun, with only 3 bullets to a life. Discipline and quick reflexes are the key to deflecting bullets and sending your opponents’ heads rolling.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 2 GB RAM Storage: 201 MB available space

reviews.review_text: So much fun, but two major flaws: for a 15 dollar game, there just isn't really enough. It's AMAZING fun, don't get me wrong, but there's only so much you can do with two modes, the second of which at first glance isn't heavily different from the other (Versus and Survival). My other problem is that there's just not clear communication with some parts of the game - sometimes you'll win even if you have less than 10 kills, or a showdown will end and nothing will happen.   It's extremely solid as a game and I commend the focus on no-online cause it really does shine on couch versus, but there just isn't enough in this for a full price recommendation in my eyes.

This game is like Joust crossed with Samurai Showdown with added chaos. Controls are exceptionally tight and it's a joy to play. It's a bummer that this game is local-only, but I can't imagine how they'd deal with latency on a game like this. Absolutely worth getting a couple controllers and a few friends together to play this. Plus, Max Temkin is a dreamboat.
got this game,  to bad i got no friends

The most underrated... This game is an incredibly intense couch competitive. The single player is lacking to say the least (it's mostly a series of challenges), but if you can find 1 other person willing to come over and play this game is worth it. Here's hoping for Samurai Gunn tournaments in the near future!
Awesome couch gaming fun. Best local multiplayer on steam... For now... (Starwhal coming soon ;))
Invite three of your friends over for some cold brews and trash talking good fun. Samurai Gunn is proof games don't have to be complicated to be good. This game rocks!
One of the best multiplayer experiences I have ever had.

This game is challenging and fun to play solo, but in local coop Samurai Gunn is just perfect. Very accessible, with simple but tight mechanics.   Don't expect new content tho, the dev don't work on this game anymore, but if you have someone to play with, what the game have to offer is sufficient, wait for a discount if 15 bucks seems to expensive, but for 5-10$ it's definitely worth it.  The design and sounds are amazing too.
Local multiplayer battles that are as deep, engaging, and entertaining as Towerfall.

This game is pretty rad. I really enjoy the simplicity of it, and the art is very cool. My only problem is the lack of online multiplayer, something I think this game really needs. Other than that, it's a really awesome game, and I recommend getting it.
This game PACKS. IT. IN.

Fast paced, but occasionally requiring a methodical approach, this game offers up more tense, glue-your-eyes-to-the-screen action than any other game in existence, presently. The controls are fluid and intuitive, and the tiny elements of samurai/Eastern flavor throughout the game really take it to the next level. Adding additional players intensifies the experience at an alarming factor. Would recommend for anyone with a competitive itch to scratch, as well as anyone just looking for endless hours of multiplayer goodness.
Simple, but super fun when you've got a few friends over. Fast, action-packed, competative gameplay and no-nonsense pick-up-and-play-ability.
Currently some of the best couch versus gaming to be had. Brings back the NES days.

Samurai Gunn is a local multiplayer game concentrating on quick game-play and deft reflexes. There is a single player survival mode but the game really shines when you play with companions. The game lacks online multiplayer, which, for some, will be a killer. However, online latency would probably decrease the percision of Samurai Gunn so this feature is not missed by me. The game is a tad bit expensive for some. But the game provides a polish that is well worth the cost. Consider buying this game if you have a group of friends that play games together. The game is especially good for a steam box in the living room.

This game is so good that it's pretty fun single-player. It's a tense two-person dueller. And with more it's a hectic party game.  There is something beautiful about how cleanly and simply it plays. You become used to the rhythm of the swords (and bullets) meeting, predict the likely moves of your opponent and even gain a kind of zen state.
finally a game that accurately portrays the superiority of glorious nipponese steel over dirty gaijin firearms

Very fun local multiplayer experience! My friends come over specifically to play this game with me. It is easy-to-learn and hard to master which is very rewarding. The survival mode is the only way to play this game single player and it gets very challenging. Would definitely recommend this game to anyone who can get some friends together to play with them!

Its simplicity is a feature. It is extremely quick to learn (~ 3 seconds) and delightfully difficult to master. I appreciate all the work that went into the controls, they feel precise and fluid at the same time. Highly recommend.

Samurai Gunn is a fast paced arena style 'Bushido-Brawler.' It's extremely easy to pick up and have hours of fun on the couch with your buddies. From the 10 life/kill Death Match to the life or death Shogun Showdown, the battles get intense.  Only having 3 bullets in your chamber makes ranged battle high stakes, but worth calculating. You have the ability to block strikes with your sword, but whoever swings second goes flying in the opposite direction, making battles even more dangerous when traps are activated or when the floors are spiked.  Although the price may seem steep for a local 'party-game' this day and age, the single-player survival mode redeems the price. Some may disagree, however the difficulty starts strong and only gets more difficult with each level. It's a challenge not to be over looked.  Overall I'd say Samurai Gunn is an 8/10 and worth a purchase regardless, but it's even more worth a purchase if you have three friends with game pads to decapitate each other. It'd be difficult to implement online capabilities since the controls are heavily based on precise timing, therefore latency would cause issues. This game is exactly where it needs to be, and provides hours of entertainment regardless of couch-buddies.
This game is super fun if you want to sit around on the couch drinking some beers and having a good time with your friends. Super easy to pick up and the matches are fast and vicious.

Where do I begin? Well The game is great +A game based on multiplayer allows you to play with up to three friends locally (Unfortuently) in either versus mode or surivival. +Even if you don't have local friends or the paitence to convince some biast friends you can still play by yourself as any of four factions with multiple skins. +Lots of maps. Did I forget to mention there is a butt load of maps? Anything from moving bamboo to moving industrial blocks to snow to BLAAAAAAAAAAH +Awesome blood/death sequences. The screen will pause momentarily when you kill someone and it is amazing. +YOU CAN BLOCK SWORDS AND BULLETS! When someone swings you can parry their attack and both of you get stunned. it makes for epic multiplayer battles. +Limited bullets make for fast paced gameplay  The bad -I have had local players 'Camp' in high places or in a spawn and just spam attack. -I have fallen through the map before and returned locked inbetween the surface -Bullets tear right through you. Their distance is not limited. -The sword doesn't seem to leave it's sheathe. The swinging animation just looks like a white mass. -The AI are very dumb and get trapped in the moving parts of the map and either get gltiched or crushed. It makes for a lame fight. Fun for multiplayer though. :D -I have no friends.   Overally it is a very good game. I can be fun for parties or just by yourself....plus it's pretty cheap! :D

This is a great game all around. Fun insta-kill action that keeps your palms sweaty. Either use your swift sword or fire you gun at range, but be weary, there is a limit on how fast you can strike with your sword, making it demand precision, and your firearm only has 3 bullets each life which can be deflected with the sword. On top of all of that, the stages themselves have interactable objects that can help/hurt you. Get 3 friends with you and play coop survival or go head to head to see just whose chi is heightened. No friends? No problem. The survival mode can be played solo as well. Only complaint from me is the price for such a simple game without a ton of content. All things considered, this is a fast, fun, adrenaline fueled combat game that can keep you occupied longer than intended. 8 out of 10
The enjoyment I get from playing this game with friends overpowers the chance that I might lose their friendship whilst playing it.

A game that is only as fun as the other games you have on your Steambox.  It's a small and fast-paced little deathmatch that's neat, but there doesn't seem to be much of anything that isn't advertised on the back of the box here. The game feels unfinished and that can be seen in the little things, such as having no ability to quit out of a match without the use of a keyboard.  There are much more complete Local Multiplayer options (Towerfall, Crawl, Lethal League) that scratch this same itch without cutting the experience short.
The best local multiplayer game ever made. Jump! Slice! Shoot! Be precise in your timing or you will die horribly! Such is the GOTY 2013

Fast, entertaining, and great for parties.  Samurai Gunn was introduced to me by a friend and I've had a hard time leaving it alone since then. It's addictive, easy to play but impossible to master. In a party setting locally with friends it's just a blast, kicking some ♥♥♥ while they yell at you from aside. It gives you the same competetive feeling that Super Smash Bros or Mario kart does. The art is amazing in how they were able to make a simplistic look compliment the speed of the game, as well as the music which fits the theme.  Really good game, if you have LAN parties often or a lot of friends I'd recommend buying this game
Pixel representation of classic shogun combat. Awesome pixel blood. Good tunes. A few hidden characters. Most fun on the couch since Netflix and chill.
My favourite local multiplayer game; it's just so fast and hectic. Games can take no more than a minute to finish but you're always itching for more.

Samurai Gunn offers an extremely fun competitive couch play experience. While matches are simplistic in nature the matches are fun and the kills are accentuated with graphics and sound effects. If you have a local group of friends and four controllers I'd gather them for a session and play several rounds. I still go back to this game every now and then with friends.
Quick, brutal, tight. Love this for couch surfing games.
